intro: Statice speciosa var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf statice, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in garden landscapes for its drought tolerance and ornamental value. The flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, adding vibrant color to gardens and coastal environments.
